intro: Ditassa reflexa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, blue, and white, are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies.
